availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert B. McNary (Caldwell County, KY, medical student; 3rd KY Cav & 20th KY Cav USA, various medical, 2nd Lieut & QM)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, medical student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William C. McNary and Ann B. McNary. Student in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Medical student in Caldwell County in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a hospital steward from December 13, 1861, to June 1862. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a second lieutenant and acting quartermaster from June 28, 1862, to February 1, 1863. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as an assistant surgeon from April 10, 1863, to July 15, 1865.
